Engineer. Gamer. Biker. Chess and fitness enthusiast.

Boston University.

's CRM unit, CES Delivery.

I am excited to announce that I will begin my Master's degree in Computer Science at
Boston University Graduate School of Arts & Sciences
under
Boston University
this fall.

I want to thank Dr.
Satish Patil, PhD
and Professor
Kishor Kolhe
for their unwavering support and guidance.¬†I would also like to acknowledge my time at
Amdocs
and express my gratitude to the company for a wonderful experience.

I'm very excited to embark on this journey and become a member of the BU Family!

5mo
Edited
Report this post
I am pleased to showcase the recent projects that I have been working on to make strides into
#fintech
. For these projects, I have used data from
Yahoo Finance
and automated paper trade in
Alpaca
.

Project #1: Real-Time Data Processing with the Quant Back-testing Framework.¬†This project showcases a Python script that enables backtesting of a trading strategy using historical stock price data. The chosen strategy is based on a Simple Moving Average (SMA) crossover and Relative Strength Index (RSI) conditions. The goal is to provide actionable insights for algorithmic trading and promote the further advancement of this field.

Blog:¬†
https://lnkd.in/ewiVuwbZ
Code:
https://lnkd.in/embx28uX
Project #2: Building a Stock Price Prediction Model using LSTM.¬†Next, I've ventured into the realm of time-series forecasting with deep learning. In this project, I've developed a Long Short Term Memory (LSTM) model to predict stock prices, leveraging LSTM's potent ability to remember past information. 

Blog:
https://lnkd.in/engcFJtB
Code:
https://lnkd.in/ekuY9hHr
Project #3: Stock Trading Back-test using Simple Moving Average. My third project involves using Python to backtest a simple moving average crossover trading strategy. This hands-on experience offers valuable insight into algorithmic trading and strategy performance analysis. Link:¬†Stock Trading Back-test

Blog:
https://lnkd.in/enxpjhPa
Code:
https://lnkd.in/eak3ckvj
Project #4: Genetic Algorithm for Financial Portfolio Optimization¬†Project four harnesses the power of Genetic Algorithms for financial portfolio optimization. It's a demonstration of how these bio-inspired algorithms can tackle complex optimization problems, like maximizing a portfolio's risk-adjusted return.

Blog:
https://lnkd.in/eNA-ayiu
Code:
https://lnkd.in/e5ziTt3w
Project #5: Using Bollinger Bands for Trading Strategy in Python¬†My fifth project employs Bollinger Bands in the formulation of a trading strategy. A tool that traders widely use, Bollinger Bands, offers valuable insights into price volatility and potential reversals, guiding strategic decision-making. 

These projects represent my commitment to understanding algorithms used in the FinTech world. I appreciate any feedback and look forward to your insights.
#finance
#fintech
#algorithmictrading
#deeplearning
#quant
#backtesting

Hello everyone,

I am excited to share that I have accepted a software engineering internship at ARD Corporation in association with
Orbit Research LLC
and the
Massachusetts Life Sciences Center
.
I am truly grateful for the chance to be part of ARD Corp.'s mission in providing innovative and accessible solutions to the disabled.

I extend my sincere thanks to ARD Corp. I am eagerly looking forward to making a meaningful impact in the lives of individuals with disabilities throughout this internship.
#internship
#softwareengineering
#lifesciences

Hello connections,
I am glad to announce that my team
Arpit Patil
,
Nancy Vachhani
and I have published our research paper titled "AI Coach in Badminton" in the IEEE Xplore journal after presenting it at the 3rd International Conference for Emerging Technology (INCET) on 27th May 2022.
I want to thank
Satish Patil, PhD
and
Aashish Rathi
and
Smit Toshniwal
for giving us their valuable insights throughout this research initiative.

Article link:
https://lnkd.in/dWRH4VMC

#research
#ieee
#ieeexplore
#sportsanalytics
#imageprocessing
#imagerecognition

Dhruv Toshniwal
CS @ Boston University | Rotaractor
1y
Edited
Report this post
I have been a member of the
Rotaract Club of Nasik Youth Force
for two years. My first year as co-head of club services was challenging. As covid-19 wreaked havoc across the country, there was little to no physical contact between the members. Nonetheless, we were able to organise donation camps, football competitions, and fundraisers. I am eternally grateful to¬†
Shivani Racca
for inviting me to join this club at its founding.
I was elected as the club's Joint Secretary in my second year. Fortunately, covid-19 was not as vigorous, so we could work offline. Every Diwali, we do a donation camp, and this year, we donated to the villages of Kharoli and Dhadoshi. We also contributed to
Rotary International
's diabetes data collection by testing 200+ individuals in Nashik. I also hosted the Alliance Cup (cricket), which was formed to encourage inter-Rotaract engagement. We were able to run various online and offline initiatives to encourage self-development, financial education, and self-care, in addition to helping to clean the roads of Nashik by partnering with 'NASHIK P..'
In my most recent contribution to the club, I discussed geopolitics and cryptocurrency with Soham A. on The NYF Podcast.

Before I part ways with the club,¬†I would like to commend
Siddhi Ambekar
,
Sahil Racca
,
Pushkaraj Thorat
,
Mahek Shahani
,
Sakshi Ahire
,
Rutuja Sahane
,
Sayoni Goswami
,
Atharva Pawar
,
Prabhjyot Khatri
and many more who desire to make a difference in their surroundings and themselves. It was a wonderful privilege to serve with them. I wish my fellow rotaractors all the best in all their future endeavours. I shall cherish this club and the memories it has brought me for the rest of my life.
#rotaract
#rotaractclub
#rotary
#rotaryinternational
#nashik
#ngo
#ngoindia
#grateful

I am delighted to share that I have joined
Amdocs
as a Software Engineering Associate. I am extremely grateful to everyone who has constantly supported me throughout my journey.

I would like to thank
Sanchit Kapur
,
Rishi Bhardwaj
and
Dr.Vishwanath Karad MIT WORLD PEACE UNIVERSITY|PUNE
for a very smooth onboarding process.

Thrilled to be a part of
Amdocs
family and looking forward to be a contributing member of this society.
